SEARCH

Package cz.cuni.mff.java.grapher

package cz.cuni.mff.java.grapher
This package implements a simple graph editing GUI tool.

A full application is implemented in the Grapher class. The building blocks of the package can also be extended and/or added to another GUI app.

The central class of the app is the Grapher class. The Grapher.main(java.lang.String[]) method is the entry point. It creates a GUI frame with a control panel and a canvas.

The drawing itself as well as user input for graph editing is handled by the GraphDisplay class. The graph is stored in a PaintedGraph instance, which contains sets of Node and Edge instances that the graph is made up of (and optionally a PartialEdge instance to represent an edge that is being created and the end of which is dragged by the user). The graph can also be saved to and loaded from a file (*.grph extension is used).

The Node and Edge objects hold data about the node, reps. edge's properties and can draw themselves.

The control panel includes to custom panels: RecentColors and ShapeSelection. The flow of information between the control panel and the GraphDisplay is handeled by GraphSettings.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Marie Hledíková
  • Class
    Description
    Edge
    Represents an edge of a PaintedGraph.
    GraphDisplay
    A custom JPanel subclass which handles displaying and editing graphs.
    Grapher
    Main widow of the Grapher application.
    GraphSettings
    Keeps the settings for a GraphDisplay instance, which it is linked to.
    GraphSettings.Action
    enum of all the possible actions that can be set with GraphSettings.
    Node
    Represents a node of a PaintedGraph.
    PaintedGraph
    Represents a graph to be drawn and edited.
    PartialEdge
    Represents a partial edge of a PaintedGraph.
    RecentColors
    A custom JPanel subclass implementing a color picker, where colors are ordered by most recently selected.
    ShapeSelection
    A custom JPanel subclass implementing a shape picker.
    ShapeSelection.Shape
    enum of all the possible shapes that can be selected with ShapeSelection.
